intro: Valerianella macrocyathus, commonly known as the common valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Valerianella macrocyathus is known for its aromatic properties and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine. It is also a host plant for several species of Lepidoptera, contributing to local biodiversity.
